## setDefaultContext() function

Set the default StyleContext used when no context is explicitly provided. This is useful for browser environments (xterm.js) where colors should always be enabled.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function setDefaultContext(context: StyleContext | undefined): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

context


</td><td>

[StyleContext](./chapstick.stylecontext.md) \| undefined


</td><td>

The context to use as default, or undefined to reset to no-colors default


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

void
